section.title: Textfile Frequently Asked Questions
section.paragraph: Q: How do I put color in these files? A1: Look at ansi.h and you need to put the literal ASCII codes.

block_quote.paragraph: They will look like: ^[[0m (for ANSI_NORMAL). That’s <ESC>[

definition_list_item.term: A2: You can enable ansi_txtfiles then use %c (or %x/%m) encoding

definition.paragraph: for ansi, however you compiled your Rhost.

section.paragraph: Q: I want to design my own txt files to read in the mush. A: Easy. Design them like help.txt would be set up, mkindx the file,

block_quote.paragraph: then you can access it via @dynhelp online.

section.paragraph: Q: Do I have to mkindx these files whenever I make changes? A: Only the ones that have ‘& ‘ index. (help.txt, wizhelp.txt, news.txt, etc)
Q: Do I have to @readcache in the game whenever I make a change? A: Only when you modify any of the files listed in README.TXTFILES. Not the ones
Q: Can’t I just make code in the mush that then is used for these silly txt files? A: Absolutely. Check ‘wizhelp file_object’.
